id.description: The globally unique ID of the product as a URI. Ideally as a resolvable URL according to ISO 18975.

name.description: The registered name of the product within the identifier scheme.

registeredId.description: The registration number (alphanumeric) of the entity within the register. Unique within the register.

idScheme.description: The identifier scheme for this product.  Eg a GS1 GTIN or an AU Livestock NLIS, or similar. If self issued then use the party ID of the issuer.

serialNumber.description: A number or code representing a specific serialised item of the product. Unique within product class.

batchNumber.description: Identifier of the specific production batch of the product.  Unique within the product class.

productImage.description: Reference information (location, type, name) of an image of the product.

description.description: A textual description providing details about the product.

productCategory.description: A code representing the product's class, typically using the UN CPC (United Nations Central Product Classification) https://unstats.un.org/unsd/classifications/Econ/cpc

furtherInformation.description: A URL pointing to further human readable information about the product.

producedByParty.description: The Party entity that manufactured the product.

producedAtFacility.description: The Facility where the product batch was produced / manufactured.

dimensions.description: The physical dimensions of the product. Not every dimension is relevant to every products.  For example bulk materials may have weight and volume but not length, with, or height."weight":{"value":10, "unit":"KGM"}

productionDate.description: The ISO 8601 date on which the product batch or individual serialised item was manufactured.

countryOfProduction.description:
The country in which this item was produced / manufactured.

    This is an enumerated value, but the list of valid values are too big, or change too often to include here. You can access the list of allowable values at this URL:  https://vocabulary.uncefact.org/CountryId

granularityLevel.description: Code to indicate the granularity of this digital product passport - item level, batch level or product class level.

dueDiligenceDeclaration.description: The due diligence declaration that conforms with the regulations of the market into which the product is sold.

materialsProvenance.description: An array of Provenance objects providing details on the origin and mass fraction of components or ingredients of the product batch.

conformityClaim.description: An array of claim objects representing various product conformity claims about the product / batch.  These can be sustainability claims, circularity claims, or any other claim type within the conformity topic list.

traceabilityInformation.description: An array of traceability events grouped by value chain process.  Where actual traceability events are unavailable or carry sensitive information, passport publishers may specify the extent to which the traceability information has been independently verified.

schema.description: The ProductInformation class encapsulates detailed information regarding a specific product, including its identification details, manufacturer, and other pertinent details.

id.description: The globally unique identifier of the registration scheme. The scheme should be registered and discoverable from vocabulary.uncefact.org/identifierSchemes

name.description: The name of the identifier scheme.

IdentifierScheme.description: An identifier registration scheme for products, facilities, or organisations. Typically operated by a state, national or global authority.

linkURL.description: The URL of the target resource.

linkName.description: A display name for the target resource

linkType.description: The type of the target resource - drawn from a controlled vocabulary

Link.description: A structure to provide a URL link plus metadata associated with the link.

id.description: The globally unique URI representing the specific classifier value

name.description: Name of the classification represented by the code

schemeName.description: The name of the classification scheme

Classification.description: A classification scheme and code / name representing a category value for a product, entity, or facility.

id.description: The globally unique ID of the entity as a resolvable URL according to ISO 18975. ExamplesProduct - id.gs1.org/01/09520123456788/21/12345  Party - abr.business.gov.au/ABN/View?abn=90664869327. Facility - did:web:facilities.example-company.com:123.

name.description: The registered name of the entity within the identifier scheme.  Examples: product - EV battery 300Ah, Party - Sample Company Pty Ltd,  Facility - Green Acres battery factory

registeredId.description: The registration number (alphanumeric) of the entity within the register. Unique within the register.

idScheme.description: The identifier scheme.  Examples : Product - id.gs1.org/01,  Party - business.gov.au/abn,  Facility - did:web:facilities.acme.com.

Identifier.description: The ID and Name of an identified entity such as a product, facility, party, standard, etc.  If the identifier is a W3C DID then the corresponding DID document SHOULD include a serviceEndpoint of type "IdentityResolver". If the identifier is not a W3C DID then the id property SHOULD be an identity resolver URL.

weight.description: the weight of the product. EG {"value":10, "unit":"KGM"}

length.description: The length of the product or packaging eg {"value":840, "unit":"MMT"}

width.description: The width of the product or packaging. eg {"value":150, "unit":"MMT"}

height.description: The height of the product or packaging. eg {"value":220, "unit":"MMT"}

volume.description: The displacement volume of the product. eg {"value":7.5, "unit":"LTR"}

Dimension.description: Overall (length, width, height) dimensions and weight/volume of an item.

value.description: The numeric value of the measure

unit.description:
Unit of measure drawn from the UNECE Rec20 measure code list.

    This is an enumerated value, but the list of valid values are too big, or change too often to include here. You can access the list of allowable values at this URL:  https://vocabulary.uncefact.org/UnitMeasureCode

Measure.description: The measure class defines a numeric measured value (eg 10) and a coded unit of measure (eg KG).

originCountry.description:
A ISO 3166-1 code representing the country of origin of the component or ingredient.

    This is an enumerated value, but the list of valid values are too big, or change too often to include here. You can access the list of allowable values at this URL:  https://vocabulary.uncefact.org/CountryId

materialType.description: The type of this material - as a value drawn from a controlled vocabulary eg from UN Framework Classification for Resources (UNFC).

massFraction.description: The mass fraction of the product represented by this material. The sum of all mass fraction values for a given passport should be 1.

massAmount.description: The mass of the material component.

recycledAmount.description: Mass fraction of this material that is recycled (eg 50% recycled Lithium)

hazardous.description: Indicates whether this material is hazardous. If true then the materialSafetyInformation property must be present

symbol.description: Based 64 encoded binary used to represent a visual symbol for a given material.

materialSafetyInformation.description: Reference to further information about safe handling of this hazardous material (for example a link to a material safety data sheet)

Material.description: The material class encapsulates details about the origin or source of raw materials in a product, including the country of origin and the mass fraction.

assessmentDate.description: The date on which this assessment was made.

declaredValue.description: The list of specific values measured as part of this assessment (eg tensile strength)

id.description: A unique identifier for the declaration. Often this will be an extension of the product.id or attestation.id. But could be a UUID.

referenceStandard.description: The reference to the standard that defines the specification / criteria

referenceRegulation.description: The reference to the regulation that defines the assessment criteria

assessmentCriteria.description: The specification against which the assessment is made.

declaredValues.description: The list of specific values measured as part of this assessment (eg tensile strength)

conformance.description: An indicator of whether or not the claim or assesment conforms to the regulatory or standard criteria.

conformityTopic.description: The conformity topic category for this assessment (eg vocabulary.uncefact.org/sustainability/emissions)

conformityEvidence.description: A URI pointing to the evidence supporting the claim. SHOULD be a URL to a UNTP Digital Conformity Credential (DCC)

Claim.description: A declaration of conformance with one or more criteria from a specific standard or regulation.

metricName.description: A human readable name for this metric (for example "Tensile strength")

metricValue.description: A numeric value and unit of measure for this metric. Could be a measured value or a specified threshold. Eg {"value":400, "unit":"MPA"} as tensile strength of structural steel

score.description: A score or rank associated with this measured metric.

accuracy.description: A percentage represented as a numeric between 0 and 1 indicating the rage of accuracy of the claimed value (eg 0.05 means that the actual value is within 5% of the claimed value.)

Metric.description: A specific measure of performance against the criteria that governs the claim.  Expressed as an array of metric (ie unit of measure) / value (ie the actual numeric value) pairs.

id.description: A unique identifier for the standard (eg https://www.iso.org/standard/60857.html).

name.example: GBA Battery Passport Greenhouse Gas Rulebook - V.2.0

issuingParty.description: The party that issued the standard

issueDate.description: The date when the standard was issued.

Standard.description: A standard (eg ISO 14000) that specifies the criteria for conformance.

id.description: The globally unique identifier of this regulation.

name.example: NNational Greenhouse and Energy Reporting (Measurement) Determination
name.description: The name of the regulation or act.

jurisdictionCountry.description:
The legal jurisdiction (country) under which the regulation is issued.

    This is an enumerated value, but the list of valid values are too big, or change too often to include here. You can access the list of allowable values at this URL:  https://vocabulary.uncefact.org/CountryId

administeredBy.description: the issuing body of the regulation. For example Australian Government Department of Climate Change, Energy, the Environment and Water

effectiveDate.description: the date at which the regulation came into effect.

Regulation.description: A regulation (eg EU deforestation regulation) that defines the criteria for assessment.

id.description: A unique identifier for the criterion within the standard  or regulation. For example CO2 emissions calculations for liquid fuel combustion.

name.example: GBA Battery rule book v2.0 battery assembly guidelines.
name.description: A name that describes this criteria.

thresholdValues.description: A conformity threshold defined by the specification (eg minimum compressive strength)

Criterion.description: A specific rule or criterion within a standard or regulation. eg a carbon intensity calculation rule within an emissions standard.

linkURL.description: The URL of the target resource.

linkName.description: A display name for the target resource

linkType.description: The type of the target resource - drawn from a controlled vocabulary

hashMethod.description: The hashing algorithm used to create the target hash.  SHA-265 is the recommended standard

encryptionMethod.description: The symmetric encryption algorithm used to encrypt the link target.  AES is the recommended standard. Decryption keys are expected to be passed out of bounds.

SecureLink.description: A binary file that is hashed ()for tamper evidence) and optionally encrypted (for confidentiality).

recyclingInformation.description: A URI pointing to recycling information for the product.

repairInformation.description: A URI pointing to repair instructions for this product.

recyclableContent.description: The fraction of the this product (my mass) that has been designed to be recyclable / re-usable. This will be be the total fraction that can avoid waste / landfill.

recycledContent.description: The fraction (by mass) of recycled / repurposed, repaired content in this product.  This will be the total virgin content fraction.

utilityFactor.description: An indicator of durability defined as the lifetime (typically measures as usage cycles) for this product divided by the industry average. For example a battery with a 10,000 cycle lifetime where industry average is 5,000 cycles will have a durability factor of 2. If unknown set to 1 or omit.

materialCircularityIndicator.description: The overall circularity performance indicator for this product. Calculated as 1 - (V+W)/2D where - V = Virgin material proportion by mass (will be 1- recycled content) - W = Waste leakage proportion by mass (will be 1 - recyclableContent)  - D = Utility factor (set to 1 if unknown).

CircularityPerformance.description: High level circularity information about this product.  Note that this does not substitute for detailed product circularity data sheet (PCDS) criteria which would be represented as a self-issued UNTP Digital Conformity Credential as a set of assessments against individual ISO PCDS criteria.

carbonFootprint.description: The carbon footprint of the product in KgCO2e per declared unit.

declaredUnit.description:
The unit of product (EA, KGM, LTR, etc) that is the basis for carbon footprint.

    This is an enumerated value, but the list of valid values are too big, or change too often to include here. You can access the list of allowable values at this URL:  https://vocabulary.uncefact.org/UnitMeasureCode

operationalScope.description: The operational scope of the emissions performance. Only scope 1 & 2, or including upstream scope 3 (cradle to gate) or upstream and downstream scope 3 (cradle to grave).

primarySourcedRatio.description: The ratio of emissions data from primary sources (ie from supplier / product specific information rather than secondary / industry averages).

reportingStandard.description: The reporting standard (eg GHG Protocol, IFRS S2, ESRS, etc) against which this product emissions performance is assessed.

EmissionsPerformance.description: Product specific characteristics.  This class is an extension point for industry specific product characteristics or performance information such as clothing size or battery capacity.

valueChainProcess.description: Human readable name for the industry specific value chain process representing this traceability data set.

verifiedRatio.description: The proportion (0 to 1) of materials in this value chain process that have been  traced using verifiable traceability event.

traceabilityEvent.description: A list of secure links to digital traceability events that support this traceability performance statement. May be encrypted for confidentiality purposes.

TraceabilityPerformance.description: An array of secure links to TraceabilityEvent objects detailing EPCIS events related to the traceability of the product batch. Events are grouped by value chain process (eg "Weaving" in textiles supply chain).

referenceStandard.name: GBA Battery Passport Greenhouse Gas Rulebook - V.2.0

referenceRegulation.name: NNational Greenhouse and Energy Reporting (Measurement) Determination

assessmentCriteria.name: GBA Battery rule book v2.0 battery assembly guidelines.
GBA Battery rule book v2.0 battery assembly guidelines.

referenceStandard.name: GBA Battery Passport Greenhouse Gas Rulebook - V.2.0

referenceRegulation.name: NNational Greenhouse and Energy Reporting (Measurement) Determination

assessmentCriteria.name: GBA Battery rule book v2.0 battery assembly guidelines.
GBA Battery rule book v2.0 battery assembly guidelines.

reportingStandard.name: GBA Battery Passport Greenhouse Gas Rulebook - V.2.0

id.description: The unique identifier of this event - SHOULD be a UUID

processType.description: A human readable name for industry specific process represented by this event.

eventTime.description: The ISO-8601 date time when the event occurred.

action.description: Code describing how an event relates to the life-cycle of the entity impacted by the event.

disposition.description:
Disposition code describing the state of the item after the event. 

    This is an enumerated value, but the list of valid values are too big, or change too often to include here. You can access the list of allowable values at this URL:  https://ref.gs1.org/cbv/Disp

bizStep.description:
A business step code drawn from a controlled vocabulary.

    This is an enumerated value, but the list of valid values are too big, or change too often to include here. You can access the list of allowable values at this URL:  https://ref.gs1.org/cbv/BizStep

bizLocation.description: A Business Location is a uniquely identified and discretely recorded geospatial location that is meant to designate the specific place where an object is assumed to be following an event until it is reported to be at a different Business Location by a subsequent event. The bizLocation must be a resolvable URI that links to facility information and geo-location data.

sensorElementList.description: An array (one for each sensor) of sensor device data sets associated with the event.

sourcePartyId.description: The source party for this supply chain transaction - typically the seller party

destinationPartyId.description: The destination party for this supply chain transaction - typically the buyer party.

bizTransaction.description:
The document type representing the trade transaction drawn from the business transaction type vocabulary.

    This is an enumerated value, but the list of valid values are too big, or change too often to include here. You can access the list of allowable values at this URL:  https://ref.gs1.org/cbv/BTT

epcList.description: The list of uniquely identified trade items included in this supply chain transaction.

quantityList.description: List of quantified product classes that are included in this transaction.  Used when the trade items do not have unique identifiers (eg 100 reels of yarn)

schema.description: Transaction represents an event in which one or more objects become associated or disassociated with one or more identified business transactions - such as the purchase / shipment of goods between buyer and seller.

sensorMetadata.description: Data that describes the physical sensor that recorded the sensor data set.

sensorReport.description: A list of sensor readings from the given sensor relevant to the traceability event context.

sensorIntegrityProof.description: An optional reference to a verifiable credential signed by the sensor device or device manufacturer that contains the digitally signed raw data associated with this sensor report.

SensorElement.description: A SensorElement is used to carry data related to an event that is captured one sensor such as an IoT device. Include one sensor property and an array of sensor data values.

device.description: The device Identifier for the sensor as a URI (typically an EPC)

dataProcessingMethod.description: The data processing method used by the sensor - should reference a documented standard criteria as a URI

Sensor.description: A physical sensor that records a sensor data set.

id.description: The globally unique ID of the product as a URI. Ideally as a resolvable URL according to ISO 18975.

name.description: The name of the product class to which the product item belongs.

Item.description: A specific serialised trade item which is an instance of a more generic product.

time.description: the timestamp at which the sensor reading was made.

sensorType.description: the measurement type of the sensor reading, as a URI reference to a measurement method specification.

uom.description:
the unit of measure for the sensor reading, drawn from UNECE rec20 code list.

    This is an enumerated value, but the list of valid values are too big, or change too often to include here. You can access the list of allowable values at this URL:  https://vocabulary.uncefact.org/UnitMeasureCode

SensorData.description: A data point read by a sensor.

productId.description: THe identifier of a product class (as opposed to a product instance) such as a GTIN code for a manufactured product.

productName.description: The registered name of the product within the identifier scheme.

quantity.description: The numeric quantity of the product class (eg 100 kg of cotton)

uom.description:
The unit of measure for the quantity value (eg Kg or meters etc) using the UNECE Rec 20 unit of measure codelist.

    This is an enumerated value, but the list of valid values are too big, or change too often to include here. You can access the list of allowable values at this URL:  https://vocabulary.uncefact.org/UnitMeasureCode

QuantityElement.description: The quantity element is used to define the quantity (eg 100 kg of a product class. Used when serialised items are not applicable.
